Role:
The Senior Technologist is responsible for building configurations
for mobile devices, creating policies and performing other system
functions in client's Microsoft InTune tenant.
This role will
develop, execute & document configurations for line of business
devices, create security policies for devices and applications and
perform tasks to maintain the InTune environment in a good working
order. The candidate will participate in meetings with client staff,
project managers, and developers. The candidate will perform these
tasks for multiple projects in a dynamic fast-paced environment.

Requirement

The candidate should have 4+ years of experience with Microsoft InTune.

Expertise and proven experience with deploying Windows 10 with
InTune and AutoPilot.

The candidate should have 7+ years of experience with mobile
device management technologies technologies.

The candidate shall have expertise and previous experience with
creating and editing powershell scripts.

The candidate shall have strong organizational and analytical
skills, with attention to detail.

The candidate must be able to clearly and effectively communicate,
in both written and verbal form.

The candidate must be able to quickly adapt to changes in business priorities.

The candidate must be able to work with change control policies in
a corporate environment. - provided by Dice

Contractor


Go to apply

b"
Role:
The Senior Technologist is responsible for building configurations for mobile devices, creating policies and performing other system functions in client's Microsoft InTune tenant. This role will develop, execute & document configurations for line of business devices, create security policies for devices and applications and perform tasks to maintain the InTune environment in a good working order. The candidate will participate in meetings with client staff, project managers, and developers. The candidate will perform these tasks for multiple projects in a dynamic fast-paced environment.

Requirement
The candidate should have 4+ years of experience with Microsoft InTune.
Expertise and proven experience with deploying Windows 10 with InTune and AutoPilot.
The candidate should have 7+ years of experience with mobile device management technologies technologies.
The candidate shall have expertise and previous experience with creating and editing powershell scripts.
The candidate shall have strong organizational and analytical skills, with attention to detail.
The candidate must be able to clearly and effectively communicate, in both written and verbal form.
The candidate must be able to quickly adapt to changes in business priorities.
The candidate must be able to work with change control policies in a corporate environment.

Contract
12 Months


Apply now

b'
We are looking for a software and app consultant to provide our clients primarily with QuickBooks (QBO) solutions that meet their business needs. This includes but is not limited to conducting training; troubleshooting systems; evaluating needs; developing configurations to support existing business processes; assisting with software implementations; and providing ongoing maintenance of implemented solutions.
This role will serve as a project lead and perform work as a participating member of multiple projects. This includes but is not limited to participating in scoping projects, developing proposals, and assisting with product demonstrations.
Responsibilities:
Under general supervision, a software consultant will be expected to:

Independently manage assigned clients, including but not limited to maintaining client documentation and files; identifying additional client needs and creating upsell opportunities; and meeting or exceeding expected billable goals;

Track and communicate project status to all necessary parties and maintaining client pipelines using our project management system;

Provide ongoing training and end-user support during and after technical system and software implementations;

Provide bookkeeping and accounting creation services, including but not limited to accounts receivable and payable reconciliation, monthly close process setup and ongoing bank feed download processing;

Use excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively correspond with external and internal parties;

Perform other functions as assigned in accordance with business need.
Required skills, experience, and knowledge:

2+ years of experience with QBO and QBO apps

QuickBooks Pro Advisor Certification (current or willing to obtain)

Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel

Intermediate knowledge of accounting practices and principles

Intermediate project management skills, including acting as a project lead

Associate’s or bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of experience and training that will provide the necessary knowledge, skill, and abilities to perform the functions of the position proficiently
Preferred skills, experience, and knowledge:

Experience with software implementations

Experience with data conversions/migrations

Experience with project management technology/methodology

Controller or management experience

Consulting firm or CPA firm experience
Job Type: Full or Part-time
Experience:

Related: 2 years (Preferred)
Compensation:

Base salary

Production based incentive compensation bonuses
Benefits offered:

Paid time off

Health insurance

Dental insurance

Other types of insurance

Retirement benefits or accounts

Flexible schedule


Go to apply 

'

b'
AHS Staffing is looking for a Technologist in Winston Salem NC, for a 13-week assignment.

Job Description:
Receive specimens for testing; evaluate specimens and test orders; determine priority of work and batches to maintain acceptable turn-around-time; recognize unacceptable and unusual specimens and handle appropriately.
Perform confirmatory testing on client samples, quality control samples and proficiency samples making measurements and calculations.
Evaluate raw and final data for accuracy; recognize and correct errors and unusual results; interpret results to produce a final report.
Maintain, calibrate, and clean instrumentation; perform scheduled and as needed maintenance and critical function checks recognizing significant changes in instrument function; trouble shoot as indicated.
Follow quality control rules; monitor controls for error detection and take corrective action; maintain laboratory records, maintenance logs, quality control charts, reagent and standard logs, and worksheets.
Participate in the instruction and training of others; demonstrate and/or explain the testing process to others or observe the testing process as performed by others.
Requirements:
Must have a BA/BS degree in Biology, Chemistry, Medical Technology, or other related science degree.
Must have MLT/MT certification
1-year of clinical lab experience (preferred)
Color Blind Testing is required


Go to apply 

'

b"
KnowBe4, Inc.
is a high growth information security company.
We are the world s largest provider of new-school security awareness training and simulated phishing.
KnowBe4 was created to help organizations manage the ongoing problem of social engineering.
Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4 s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.
We are ranked 1 best place to work in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine and have placed 1 or 2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last four years.
We also just had our 26th record-setting quarter in a row The Technologist is responsible for identifying the best technology solutions to address the organization s needs and implementing such solutions in a cost-effective way.
He or she is charged with determining the technical requirements of a given project, analyzing those requirements, developing solutions that outline the requisite system controls and protocols, and then clearly communicating the solution to key stakeholders.
Responsibilities: Lead the charge in evaluating and implementing hardware and software solutions as needed to support the organization Expand and enhance current IT systems through scripting, programming and development Work closely with non-IT departments to provide guidance and support related to information technology queries for projects as requested Work with 3rd party vendors to successfully implement technology and/or troubleshoot complex issues Oversee proof of concept from the IT standpoint when vetting prospective vendors Research new technologies and make recommendations to senior management which includes but is not limited to, forecasting future needs and/or capacity planning, and participating in the strategic planning/evolution of the organization's internal and outsourced systems, security and business continuity requirements that are scalable to meet the organization's growth expectations Work closely with other departments to streamline implementation and utilization of new technology with business operations Assist in the automation of employee movement tasks (ie.
Onboard, Offboard, Move, Change, etc) Prioritize infrastructure tasks to ensure flawless work experience and access for end-users both on-premise and remotely.
Improve the maturity, capability, and visibility of software development in the organization.
Perform technical assessments that are helpful and accurate to provide to key stakeholders in case of mergers and acquisitions.
Manage incoming Jira / Zendesk escalated incidents and ensure workload distribution, successful execution, and to resolve escalated incidents within the SLA resolution times.
Requirements: Strong verbal and written communications Excellent time management and organization skills Flexibility and adaptability to manage concurrent, multiple projects while maintaining focus on critical deadlines Strong skills in scripting and programming Excellent troubleshooting/analytical skills Ability to effectively communicate technical issues to non-technical people.
Ability to effectively and efficiently prioritize demanding projects on short notice.
Ability to effectively negotiate conflicts and troubleshoot complex problems Effective problem-solving and decision-making skills Strong interpersonal and listening skills Strong organizational and problem-solving skills Ability to handle confidential matters with discretion Ability to cultivate and maintain positive relationships with individuals at all organizational levels Technical certifications in networking, security, and/or server administration a plus ITIL certification a plus Note: An applicant assessment, background check and drug test may be part of your hiring procedure.
No recruitment agencies, please.


Go to apply 

"

b'
Title: Technologist

Location: Maryland Heights, MO

Job Summary:

Provide middleware services for orchestration and activation. Design and develop activation services and their interface to corresponding network elements. Perform software engineering and application development design for the cable industry. Solve complex business technical issues using Oracle OSS Suite and ASAP product. Develop Oracle ASAP code for communicating between devices and configuring cable and network devices. Create Java, Springboot, Micro services to assist in functionality from ASAP to Meso platform. Integrate and consolidate platforms. Develop Java for service development. Simplify and enhance the user experience. Collaborate with management and stakeholders in setting strategies and tactical implementing procedures. Research new technology products and make strategy recommendations. Coordinate and perform routine operating system and application reconciliations maintenance, including backup and recovery processes for applications and databases. Develop plan for business continuity, including monitoring system utilization and performance for capacity planning purposes. Act as technical expert to provide support and software upgrades for applications. Design and configure customer-based systems and applications and provide guidance to database administrators in the configuration, tuning and maintenance of databases. Design disaster recovery plans, and assist in troubleshooting application, networking and operating systems issues. Manage relationships with hardware and software vendors.

Education/Qualifications:

Bachelor s degree, (or foreign equivalent), in Information Technology, Electronics Engineering, Management Information Systems or a related field. Must have 5 years of experience performing software engineering and application development design for the cable industry; developing Oracle ASAP code for communicating between devices and configuring cable and network devices; and developing Java for service development.


Go to apply

b"
What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the extra mile to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Duties include configuring, supporting, and troubleshooting both hardware and software in order to carry out 3D graphics driver software testing for AMD's line of discrete and integrated graphics hardware. These activities include verification and testing, defect identification and analysis, results and issue reporting, and support for software debug activities.
Demonstrated experience with building custom computer systems and installing and configuring operating system, driver, and application softwware is required, as are strong communication skills. Experience with current massively multi-player online (MMO) gaming application installation, configuration, and game play is also required.
Previous experience in software testing is a plus.

Requisition Number: 76220
Country: United States State: Florida City: Orlando
Job Function: Engineering Support
AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. We consider candidates regardless of age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status. Please click here for more information.


Go to apply

b"
SummaryThe Technologist manufactures complex products which includes enzymes, purified antibodies, and both small and large scale fermentations for recombinant and non\-recombinant organisms\.

# Job Description

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

+ Generally, product lines assigned to this level are the most difficult and complex manufactured at BD\-Grayson such as enzymes, purified proteins including antibodies used in BD's various assay platforms\. Almost 80% of the associate's time is required for these duties\. Must be able to manufacture assigned product lines independently within 6 months\.

+ Coordinate transfer and scale up of R&D products into standard manufacturing environment and procedures\. This would include pilot batches, documentation, equipment acquisition, etc\.

+ Legacy process improvements of current procedures\.

+ Customer interaction may be required both internal & external\.

+ Assist in the completion of the documentation required under GMPs, OSHA, EPA and corporate policies\. Performs final review of all bulk manufacturing shop orders prior to release to Quality Assurance\. About 15\-20% of associate's time is required for these duties\.

+ Makes technical decisions regarding product status and delivery dates\.

+ Assists Quality Assurance as required in Quality Action Teams and customer complaints\.

+ Analyzes internal product failures\.

+ Writes/reviews DIs and SOPs for departmental operations, Manufacturing BOMs, and cost routings\.

+ Must be experienced/familiar with aseptic techniques\.

+ For employees assigned task lists inclusive of fermentation activities for enzyme formulation, also will perform setup, operation and cleaning of the various fermenters, software, downstream processing equipment and other ancillary equipment in this laboratory\.

**Knowledge and Skills:**

+ Must be able to lift 30 lbs\.

+ Must be able to endure prolonged standing\.

+ Must be non\-sensitive to chemicals used in manufacturing processes\.

+ Must have high visual acuity, \(corrected or uncorrected\), to be able to detect articulate flocculation patterns or reactions\. **Education and Experience:**

+ If candidate possesses 10\+ years of relevant experience in the field of fermentation and purification, degree will not be a limiting factor for hire\.

+ M\.S\. in Microbiology or Biochemistry with 2\-3 years of related experience or B\.S\. in Microbiology or Biochemistry with 3\-5 years directly related experience, which should include experience with Protein Purification including, Chromatography and electrophoresis, preferred\.

+ Specialized academic training such as that demonstrated by possession of an appropriate academic degree\.

+ Must possess good scientific aptitude and abstract problem solving/trouble shooting abilities\.

+ Must be able to develop new process technologies for manufacturing, resulting in more efficient, less costly product lines\.

\#LI\-OPS

# Primary Work LocationUSA GA \- Grayson

# Additional Locations

# Work ShiftUS BD 1st Shift 8am\-5pm \(United States of America\)

Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We do not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, military eligibility or veteran status, or any other protected status.


Go to apply 

"

b"
**Are you looking for a career that matters?**

We believe every person deserves a chance for a healthy life, free from illness and full of possibility. We see a world full of healing, with viable care options available to those with limited choices today. We envision new ways of providing physicians, pharmacists and nurses with technologies that not only treat chronic diseases, but also work to prevent them. We're looking for team members who are motivated to learn, grow and innovate, while making a meaningful difference for millions of people around the world.

**About Baxter's Cleveland, MS Facility:**

**Cleveland's technology and automation is cutting edge. It is the U.S. sole source for plastic pour bottles, glass IV, and various reconstitution devices. This facility produces a number of major product lines with a diverse array of automated manufacturing technologies ranging from bottle solution filling, injection molding, tubing extrusion, and device assembly.** **Our Cleveland plant has been an integral part of Baxter for over 60 years. The work is challenging and rewarding, as Baxter offers competitive compensation and benefits. Baxter encourages and values every employee and believes that all can make a contribution to advancing healthcare for patients; work to be proud of.**

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

+ Responsible for performing a wide variety of research and/or development laboratory tasks and experiments.

+ Perform detailed analyses and tests required for research, development or quality control of processes and products.

+ Compile, analyze and interpret preliminary results. Write experimental reports, summaries and protocols.

+ Develop and maintain record keeping for experiment performed.

+ Perform troubleshooting and calibration of instruments.

+ Apply advanced techniques and procedures to assigned projects. Work is performed under minimal supervision.

+ Responsible for setup, acquisition and maintenance of laboratory equipment and supplies.

+ Train other lab personnel on equipment, processes and procedures.

+ Write experimental reports, summaries and protocols.

+ of your request along with your contact information.

**Qualifications**

+ High School diploma or equivalent, AA Degree preferred, 5+ years experience in related field.

+ Ability to handle multiple task assignments with minimal supervision to ensure customer needs are met.

+ Demonstrate skills in test method development, test fixture design and development, data analysis and report writing.

+ Ability to perform basic statistical analysis and make recommendations to engineers.

+ Demonstrates expertise in particular functional area

+ High School diploma or equivalent, AA Degree preferred, 5+ years experience in related field.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

EEO is the Law at

EEO is the law - Poster Supplement at

Pay Transparency Policy at

**Reasonable Accommodations**

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Our products and therapies touch the lives of millions of people around the world every day, which is why we are focused on transformative innovations that bring smarter, more personalized care to all of us. For 87 years and counting, we have been at the critical intersection where the ideas that save and sustain lives meet the providers who make it all happen. And now, we are determined to realize our boldest opportunities to transform global healthcare for years to come.


Go to apply 

"

b"
Overview

A Technologist, IT is an experienced technology partner responsibility for conceptual technology design and implementation of technology solutions that support business needs and deliverables to contribute to substantial and direct revenue increases or cost savings to the organization. The individual collaborates on product and software design development and maintains design governance across projects that span multiple application platforms (including in-house solutions, modulating Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) applications and Software as a Service Application (SaaS)), as well as the infrastructure solutions that deliver full platform functionality that efficiently and effectively service key business processes.

Responsibilities

* Provide technical expertise and collaboration in engineering and architecture efforts for technology solutions to support key business needs and deliverables; apply design governance across projects, applications and infrastructure.

* Participate in product and software design and development across technical teams; conduct problem analysis and requirements development; develop roadmaps and plans and track against such; support RFP evaluations; participate in build/buy decisions and vendor selection efforts, as well as cost modeling and project estimations for budgetary input.

* Assure design integrity for solutions delivered in production to the business, staff, faculty and students.

* Assess/document existing design with respect to maintenance and stability of existing platforms; apply critical and strategic thinking to generate ideas that will lead to the next generation of platform designs supporting organization processes, staff, faculty and students.

* Participate in meetings and councils regarding technical and business-driven initiatives to develop and translate technical solutions to meet business needs.

* Perform other duties as assigned or apparent.

Qualifications

Basic Requirements:

* Bachelor's Degree and 7 years of related IT experience OR Master's Degree and 8 years of related IT experience

* Creation of technical solutions that are being/have been used by cross-functional business operations

Additional Qualifications:

* Ability to ideate future solutions and technical designs to meet critical business needs

* Familiarity with technical modeling approaches (e.g., UML, E/R diagrams, flowcharting) and an ability to create effective diagrams, cost estimations, and design documentation

* Adaptive learning of complex technical systems

* Creative approach to problem solving with a proven ability to focus on details

* Strong decision-making capabilities with the ability to balance theoretical solutions against achievable goals including financial, performance, and operational excellence

* Excellent team work skills

* Strong written and oral communication skills with an ability to engage with the business on its own terms as well as with technical teams across various technical disciplines
SDL2017


Go to apply

is a leading global life sciences company that is deeply integrated in guiding patient care, providing comprehensive clinical laboratory and end-to-end drug development services. With a mission to improve health and improve lives, LabCorp delivers world-class diagnostic solutions, brings innovative medicines to patients faster and uses technology to improve the delivery of care. LabCorp reported net revenues of over $10 billion in 2017.

This position requires a Bachelors Medical Technologist Degree or equivalent and city/state licenses or permits to qualify as a Technologist w/1-3 years experience in a Clinical Laboratory, preferably in molecular. Experience with Panther instrument preferred. ASCP or AMT certification preferred. Must be able to pass standardized color vision test and work overtime as business needs require.

Under general supervision, the Molecular Medical Technologist performs a variety of routine and complex clinical laboratory tests on body fluids and substances requiring independent judgment, speed and accuracy and with the highest standard of professional performance.

* Manage problems that affect test performance or reporting of test results.

* Adhere to quality control procedures including documentation, instrument and procedural calibrations and instrument maintenance.

* Perform all job duties in accordance with established standards and quality control to ensure high quality patient care. *Will draw patients and conduct urine drug screens.

* Other duties as assigned.

This is full time position with great medical benefits, 18 personal/sick days, 6 holidays, 401k matching, life insurance, access to discounts at major retailers, career growth opportunities, and other benefits.

Tuesday - Saturday, 9:00 pm - 6:00 am; overtime as business needs require
SDL2017

Summary

The Technologist manufactures complex products which includes enzymes, purified antibodies, and both small and large scale fermentations for recombinant and non-recombinant organisms.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities:

* Generally, product lines assigned to this level are the most difficult and complex manufactured at BD-Grayson such as enzymes, purified proteins including antibodies used in BD's various assay platforms. Almost 80% of the associate's time is required for these duties. Must be able to manufacture assigned product lines independently within 6 months.

* Coordinate transfer and scale up of R&D products into standard manufacturing environment and procedures. This would include pilot batches, documentation, equipment acquisition, etc.

* Legacy process improvements of current procedures.

* Customer interaction may be required both internal & external.

* Assist in the completion of the documentation required under GMPs, OSHA, EPA and corporate policies. Performs final review of all bulk manufacturing shop orders prior to release to Quality Assurance. About 15-20% of associate's time is required for these duties.

* Makes technical decisions regarding product status and delivery dates.

* Assists Quality Assurance as required in Quality Action Teams and customer complaints.

* Analyzes internal product failures.

* Writes/reviews DIs and SOPs for departmental operations, Manufacturing BOMs, and cost routings.

* Must be experienced/familiar with aseptic techniques.

* For employees assigned task lists inclusive of fermentation activities for enzyme formulation, also will perform setup, operation and cleaning of the various fermenters, software, downstream processing equipment and other ancillary equipment in this laboratory.

Knowledge and Skills:

* Must be able to lift 30 lbs.

* Must be able to endure prolonged standing.

* Must be non-sensitive to chemicals used in manufacturing processes.

* Must have high visual acuity, (corrected or uncorrected), to be able to detect articulate flocculation patterns or reactions.

Education and Experience:

* If candidate possesses 10+ years of relevant experience in the field of fermentation and purification, degree will not be a limiting factor for hire.

* M.S. in Microbiology or Biochemistry with 2-3 years of related experience or B.S. in Microbiology or Biochemistry with 3-5 years directly related experience, which should include experience with Protein Purification including, Chromatography and electrophoresis, preferred.

* Specialized academic training such as that demonstrated by possession of an appropriate academic degree.

* Must possess good scientific aptitude and abstract problem solving/trouble shooting abilities.

* Must be able to develop new process technologies for manufacturing, resulting in more efficient, less costly product lines.

#LI-OPS

Primary Work Location

USA GA - Grayson

Additional Locations

Work Shift

US BD 1st Shift 8am-5pm (United States of America)

Full-time Reference Laboratory Technologist needed right outside of Chicago!

Job Summary: This position exists to perform all aspects of routine transfusion service laboratory testing and basic serological problem resolution in the area of immunohematology. The incumbent following training and competency assessment is authorized to complete all immunohematology tests listed in Volume 3 of the Transfusion Service SOPs An index of these SOPs can be found in the Master Control System. This position also provides for the manufacturing and distribution of appropriate products for transfusion and the completion of all supporting clerical and QC activities

- Perform all routine pretransfusion testing including quality control to obtain serologically safe products for transfusion consistent with SOP and cGMP requirements.
- Resolve basic serological problems consistent with SOP and cGMP requirements.
- Perform all lab assistant responsibilities consistent with SOP and cGMP requirements as needed.
- Accurately and professionally communicate pertinent clinical information to the hospital staff and obtain necessary information from these same sources, always adhering to patient confidentiality requirements and HIPAA requirements.
- Provide technical support to internal staff and external hospital staff.

Job Qualifications:
* Recent MLT, MT, BB or SBB graduate (within 6 months) that is eligible for ASCP certification required (must attain certification within 1 year of hire).
* AS degree with MLT (ASCP) certification preferred.
* BS/BA degree in medical technology, biology, or a related science with MT (ASCP) or BB(ASCP) or SBB(ASCP) strongly preferred.
* 2 -3 years previous blood bank/transfusion or general laboratory experience preferred.

Offering competitive compensation and complete benefits.
For more information, please submit your resume for review!

Полная занятость, полный день

«ВЕРОФАРМ» (группа Abbott) – российский производитель лекарственных препаратов и изделий медицинского назначения, портфель компании насчитывает более 300 наименований продукции.

«ВЕРОФАРМ» является крупнейшим в России производителем онкологических лекарственных средств, а также известен в таких направлениях медицины как женское здоровье, гастроэнтерология, инфекционные заболевания, дерматология и других мировых отраслях здравоохранения.

Развивая достижения и активы «ВЕРОФАРМ», Abbott инвестирует в модернизацию производственной инфраструктуры компании, в расширение научно-исследовательских возможностей, маркетинговые и образовательные программы на благо россиян и российской системы здравоохранения.

Мы приглашаем Вас присоединиться к нашей команде в роли:

**Технолога**

**Обязанности:**

+ Контроль за соблюдением технологической дисциплины при выполнении персоналом производственной программы

+ Контроль наличия соответствующих стандартных операционных процедур на рабочих местах

+ Контроль хранения полупродуктов, готовой продукции в соответствии с требованиями НТД

+ Контроль за выполнением приказов, распоряжений, мероприятий и предписаний по ведению технологических процессов

+ Своевременное заполнение протоколов серий в процессе производства,

+ Сдача оформленных протоколов серий на экспертизу,

+ Оперативное устранение замечаний к протоколам серий

+ Разработка и пересмотр инструкций, стандартных операционных процедур и другой нормативно-технической документации

+ Контроль движения сырья и вспомогательных материалов при производстве препаратов обеспечение достоверности учета сырья, материалов и полупродуктов на смене,

+ Соответствие их остатков на конец смены данным первичного учета

**Требования:**

+ Высшее фармацевтическое образование

+ Умение работать с технической литературой, нормативными и методическими документами

+ Знание принципов организации производства, технологических процессов и режимов производства; методов предупреждения и устранения производственного брака; принципов работы основного технологического оборудования; требований, предъявляемых к технической документации, сырью, материалам, полуфабрикатам и готовой продукции

**Условия:**

+ Конкурентоспособная заработная плата.

+ Бонусный план.

+ Отличные возможности для карьерного и профессионального роста.

+ Корпоративное обучение.

+ Изучение иностранных языков.

+ Страхование жизни

LabCorp is seeking a Technologist to join our Immunology lab team in Burlington, NC! The Serology (Diagnostic Immunology) Department, located within the Center for Esoteric Testing, offers a comprehensive menu of antibody testing methods for diagnosing and monitoring treatment of diseases. Assays performed in the in our department utilize a variety of scientific techniques including EIA, IFA, and other non-automated and automated procedures for Autoimmune and Infectious Disease testing. Open to entry level and Senior level candidates as well as Technicians with Associate MLT degrees.
Responsibilities:
Prepare specimens for analysis; evaluate specimens and test orders; determine priority of work and batches to maintain acceptable turn-around-time; recognize unacceptable and unusual specimens and handle appropriately.
Perform testing on biological samples, quality control samples and proficiency samples making measurements and calculations.
Evaluate raw and final data for accuracy; recognize and correct errors and unusual results; interpret results to produce a final report.
Maintain, calibrate, and clean instrumentation; perform scheduled and as needed maintenance and critical function checks recognizing significant changes in instrument function; trouble shoot as indicated.
Perform required QC/QA duties including: following quality control rules; monitor controls for error detection and take corrective action; maintain laboratory records, maintenance logs, quality control charts, reagent and standard logs, and worksheets.
Perform SRS and reference accept functions as required.
Other duties as assigned by management.

Requirements

Requirements:
Must have a BA/BS degree in Biology, Chemistry, Medical Technology, or other related science as required by CLIA.
1-3 years of experience in a clinical laboratory preferred.
Must be able to work in a team oriented environment.
Color Blindness Testing will be required upon hire.

Performs technical laboratory procedures with high degree of accuracy and efficiency.

Operates laboratory equipment and performs testing according to established procedure/protocol.

Performs scheduled maintenance on laboratory instrumentation.

Recognizes, troubleshoots, and documents equipment problems, contacting service when appropriate.

Responds appropriately to panic values by notifying the appropriate caregiver.

Produces accurate and timely laboratory test results.

Evaluates laboratory test results according to age and/or diagnosis.

Utilizes laboratory equipment and supplies/consumables with minimal waste.

Reviews laboratory reports in the absence of Lead Technologist; notifies Manager, Laboratory Services of problems/ concerns.

Assists in research and evaluation of procedures at the direction of the Lead Technologist.

Trains new personnel in the operation of laboratory instrumentation and testing procedures.

Evaluates quality control results within established parameters.

Maintains quality control records by completing corrective action forms, logging quality control values, etc.

Corrects detected problems, documenting corrective action taken.
Education & Experience:
Successful completion of the following is required:

Bachelor's degree in medical technology or one of the biological or chemical sciences from an accredited institution

Clinical Laboratory experience with a passing score in the U.S. Public Health Service proficiency examination for Clinical Laboratory Technologists.
MT, MLT or HT certification by ASCP plus 2 years of experience in a high complexity laboratory.
Bachelor's degree, along with any suitable combination of training or experience is acceptable.
Licensure & Certification:
See Education and Experience.
Physical Demands:
Works in a clean, well-lighted environment. Requires walking, standing and ascending/descending stairs approximately 70% of the time. Requires carrying supplies weighing up to 50 lbs.; approximately 40% of the time. Requires bending and reaching approximately 40% of the time; lifting and pushing/pulling supplies weighing up to 50 lbs. approximately 25% of the time. Requires substantial visual acuity and manual dexterity to handle specimens. Potential for regular exposure to communicable diseases and/or blood and body substances and hazardous materials requiring the observance of Standard Precautions and safe handling practices. Potential for exposure to disagreeable elements, such as odors, sights, drainage, etc.

5,000 Sign on Bonus for Qualified Candidates!
Under the direct supervision of a Radiologist the CT Technologist performs exams at a technical level that does not require direct supervision over technical detail. This position requires advanced medical imaging knowledge, including skill in cross-sectional anatomy. A complete knowledge of all types of diagnostic CT exams and interventional procedures is required. Uses independent judgment, ingenuity and acquired knowledge to obtain quality diagnostic images. Assists with interventional procedures.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Interviews patients, explains procedures and risks, prepares patient and sets up for examination.
Schedules tests, determines appropriate protocol through patient's history and conferring with patient's physician and/or radiologist. Integrates with HIS, RIS, and PACS systems for patient updates.
Conducts appropriate procedure utilizing the predetermined protocol. Acquires images, reviews, and sends to PACS with final verification of images.
Maintains accreditation status with ACR standards.
Chooses appropriate computer functions for post-processing of images.
Maintains a clean and safe patient care area and working environment.
Responsible for patient's well-being before, during, and/or after scan.
Proficient in the appropriate use of the power injector for the time delivery of contrast during the acquisition of images.
Assists radiologist in specialized procedures such as tumor localization and guided biopsies.
Assures that patient's clinical data coincides with and matches the type of exam that is being ordered. Follows up with Doctor's office when exam ordered is in question and does not seem reasonable given the patient's clinical record.
Assures female patients of child bearing ages are screened for possibility of pregnancy.
Demonstrates skill in IV insertion.
Documents exams into radiology system to ensure proper billing.
Processes CT exams utilizing the teleradiology system during off shift hours. Able to trouble shoot problems and contact correct help lines if necessary.
Performs quality assurance in accordance with the American College of Radiology guidelines for CT.
Transports patients when needed.
Must be able to speak, read and write effectively using the English language.
This position requires the incumbent work cooperatively with department staff by sharing in holiday hours.
Follow the guidelines of ALARA.
Responsible for adhering to all radiation protection standards and for donning all radiation protection apparel inclusive of wearing and changing of current monitoring devices.
Performs other related duties as required.

REQUIREMENTS:

Must have basic computer skills and ability to access internet and other programs applicable to Waterbury Hospital procedures.
Perform automated functions that fall within job responsibility.
A high school diploma or GED equivalent; graduate of an ARRT approved Radiological Technology School program is required.
Registration and certification with the American Registry of Radiological Technologists and licensure with the State of Connecticut are required.
Must remain current with ARRT continuing education requirements and maintain an active ARRT certificate.
Advanced certification from the ARRT in Computerized Tomography is expected from the incumbent within one year of hire.
Must have a full knowledge of CT exams and interventional procedures. Technologist must be capable of performing exams independently.
Must have a complete working knowledge in the principals of physics, anatomy, medical terminology, sterile technique and radiation protection as it relates to CT practice.


Go to apply

Our Automation Solutions division currently seeks an experienced Instrumentation Technologist to join our Nanaimo, BC office. This position would be responsible for the design, development, and delivery of high quality, innovative engineering solutions that improves plant productivity, reliability, and sustainability for our North American customers.

Responsibilities may include but are not necessarily limited to the following:
Audit industrial facilities and develop engineering designs and estimates for electrical instrumentation upgrades
Correctly size and specify instruments and control valves for their process application
Review vendor quotes and documentation to ensure appropriate instrument application
Prepare and evaluate tender and construction packages, including electrical and instrumentation design drawings, installation specifications, and other supporting documentation
Develop control narratives, logic diagrams, Process & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs), instrument indexes, instrument data sheets and instrument loop sheets
Provide technical installation direction to engineering contractors and/or mill personnel
Meaningful Work - ANDRITZ remains forefront of future engineering technologies and is committed to successfully delivering innovative, high-quality, environmentally responsible solutions to our customers, shaping the future we live in. Why are we so successful? Because we are passionate and love what we do!
Full Project Involvement - Working both locally and globally in a variety of key industries, our employees follow their design throughout the entire project lifecycle: from the initial concept, right into the field for commissioning. Employees and customers are both direct benefactors of this "total commitment" approach.
Professional and Personal Growth - As we continue to innovate and grow, so do our employees. From challenging and innovative work assignments to structured training programs, ANDRITZ provides employees with countless opportunities to grow their knowledge and be the best both professionally and personally.
Flexible Opportunities - ANDRITZ understands that life is a dynamic balance between personal and professional and believes that a successful and fulfilling career varies between people so we offer a broad range of flexible opportunities.

In addition to a challenging career, professional development opportunities, and an inclusive and supportive work environment, to reward your commitment we offer a competitive salary that increases with technical capability, comprehensive benefits package, flexible work environment, and a 401(k) retirement plan.
In addition to a challenging career, professional development opportunities, and an inclusive and supportive work environment, to reward your commitment we offer a competitive salary that increases with technical capability, comprehensive benefits package, flexible work environment, and a defined contribution pension plan.
When selecting candidates, we will be looking for the following essential skills, abilities, and experience:
Technology diploma; instrumentation focus preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Registered (or eligible for registration) with ASTTBC
Legally entitled to work in Canada
Ability and willingness to travel to domestic and international sites
Other valued, but non-essential skills, abilities, and experience include:
Pulp & Paper industry experience
Consulting engineering experience; preferably in industrial automation engineering
Commissioning, construction, and start-up experience
ANDRITZ is an international technology group providing plants, systems, equipment, and services for various industries. The company is one of the technology and global market leaders in the hydropower business, the pulp and paper industry, the metal working and steel industries, and in solid/liquid separation in the municipal and industrial segments. Other important fields of business are animal feed and biomass pelleting, as well as automation, where ANDRITZ offers a wide range of innovative products and services in the IIoT (Industrial Internet of Things) sector under the brand name of Metris. In addition, the company is active in power generation (steam boiler plants, biomass power plants, recovery boilers, and gasification plants) and environmental technology (flue gas and exhaust gas cleaning plants) and offers equipment for the production of nonwovens, dissolving pulp, and panelboard, as well as recycling plants.

Are you looking to work for a world class specialty testing diagnostic lab? LabCorp is seeking a Technologist to join our Special Chemistry lab team in Burlington, NC! LabCorp's Special Chemistry lab perform over 80 different procedures with varying methodologies. Over 2.9 million tests are performed by this department each year!
As a technologist, you will perform tests and analyses according to established procedures in designated technical department. This Special Chemistry position will be responsible for utilizing electrophoresis techniques for the performance and interpretation of protein and lipoprotein analyses, high pressure chromatography (HPLC) for hemoglobin fractionation with interpretation, and isoenzymes with interpretation.
Open to entry level and senior level candidates as well as Technician candidates (MLTs) with Associate degrees in Medical Laboratory Technology (MLT).
This position will have a Baylor schedule and third shift hours from Friday 11:00pm-6:00am and Saturday-Sunday 6:00pm-7:00am.
Responsibilities:
Receive specimens for testing; evaluate specimens and test orders; determine priority of work and batches to maintain acceptable turn-around-time; recognize unacceptable and unusual specimens and handle appropriately.
Perform testing on biological samples, quality control samples and proficiency samples making measurements and calculations.
Evaluate raw and final data for accuracy; recognize and correct errors and unusual results; interpret results to produce a final report.
Maintain, calibrate, and clean instrumentation; perform scheduled and as needed maintenance and critical function checks recognizing significant changes in instrument function; trouble shoot as indicated.
Perform required QC/QA duties including: following quality control rules; monitor controls for error detection and take corrective action; maintain laboratory records, maintenance logs, quality control charts, reagent and standard logs, and worksheets.
Perform SRS and reference accept functions as required.
Other duties as assigned by management.

Requirements

Requirements:
Technologists: Must have a BA/BS degree in Biology, Chemistry, Medical Technology, or other related science as required by CLIA.
Technicians: Must have an Associates degree in Medical Laboratory Technology (MLT)
1+ years of experience in a clinical laboratory preferred
ASCP certification a plus
Strong computer skills with knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Must be able to work in a team oriented environment.
Color Blindness testing required upon hire.

At Studio Munge, we bring spaces to life for many of the world’s most iconic luxury brands. Our spaces are tactile, layered and immersive. We have established our reputation through storytelling and concept driven designs. Together, we do more than interior design. We think beyond our spatial limitations; we imagine the shared experience. Together we create more than pretty pictures, we fashion exciting, award-winning and time-tested spaces. Are you our next dedicated and inspired team member?
Our Technologists are the “go to” team members for project drawing and technical related issues and tasks. At Studio Munge, this role goes beyond the production of accurate and coordinated drawing packages. Our Technologists pride themselves in their ability collaborate with designers to capture design intents and translate design development sets into comprehensive construction drawing packages. They deftly juggle sensitivity to the design while maintaining technical work aligned with the core design intent.
If this sounds like a great way to express your multiple talents, join Alessandro and our dynamic team in designing a better world, one space at a time.
RESPONSIBILITIES

– Work closely with Project Designers and Project Managers to develop and produce innovative spaces that achieve envisioned design
– Produce the highest quality of interior design drawings and detail designs, architectural and millwork fabrications
– Work closely with Project Design teams to define timelines, goals, and expectations
– Plan and develop technical drawings packages by translating design development direction into full working drawings
– Devise and implement various productivity tools in drawing production without sacrificing drawing standards, accuracy, and quality
– Coordinate all consultant drawing sets and specifications
– Comply with company and client drawing standards
– Take ownership of projects assigned
– Promote company culture and demonstrate positive attitude
QUALIFICATIONS

– Post-secondary education in architecture or architectural drafting
– Minimum 5+ years of experience with a strong ability to translate design development direction into technical working drawings
– Emphasis on international, high-end hospitality and residential project experience
– Recognized design savvy
– Demonstrated a team-oriented and collaborative approach to your work
– Experience collaborating with Interior Designers and FF&E experts and co-ordination with consultants
– Comprehensive understanding of the building envelope and interior architectural space, its impact in interior designing
– Strong understanding of millwork design and construction processes
– Exposure to current global laws and regulations related to the standard practices of interior design
– Accustomed to working in changing, fast paced, deadline-oriented setting
– Excellent time and priority management skills with strong grasp of time needed to produce complex drawing packages
– Ability to communicate, translate, and review drawings in Chinese, Mandarin an asset
SOFTWARE SKILLS

– AutoCAD
– Revit – possess a strong understanding of Revit workflow
– SketchUp – able to produce models and renderings
– Autodesk Architecture
– Bluebeam Revu
– Adobe Acrobat
– Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITY - Job Summary (general statement of purpose or objective of position)

Medical Technologists provide information for diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease by conducting medical laboratory tests, procedures, and analyses with little or no supervision. The Medical Technologist's job includes preparing the samples for examination, using automated equipment and specialized instrumentation, performing numerous complicated tests simultaneously and accurately interpreting the results in a timely manner in order to enable the clinician to utilize the data when making treatment decisions.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS - Knowledge, skills, abilities, license, registration, certification, education, and experience

Bachelor's degree in a chemical, physical, biological or clinical laboratory science or medical technology from an accredited institution. Will consider a Bachelor's degree in other areas if associates degree in medical laboratory technology is already obtained. This will be the discretion of the supervisor at the time of application or promotion.
National Registry for Medical Technology/Clinical Laboratory Science (ASCP or equivalent) or registry eligible. Must successfully complete or be actively pursuing registration by end of first year of employment as evidenced by notification of scheduled test date.
Possess language, math and reasoning skills which allow for the analysis, interpretation and valid conclusion to be made during data collection and during mechanical or scientific procedures. Must be able to effectively present gathered data orally or in writing to management or regulatory agencies.

b"
Performs chemical, microscopic, & bacteriologic tests to provide data for use in treatment & diagnosis of disease. Applies techniques used in fields of microbiology, histo-pathology, hematology, diagnostic immunology, immunohematology, chemistry or morphological examinations.

Essential Functions:

- Conducts laboratory testing. Initiates & implements course of action based upon standard operating procedures.

- Organizes work flow to accomplish efficient & accurate output. Reviews & verifies results for accuracy, & credibility prior to release. Records & reports results in timely manner.

- Problem-solves to achieve acceptable test results & assures optimal system & instrument operations.

- Interprets & verifies lab findings w/regard to type & quality of specimen submitted. Correlates test results w/available clinical information & other laboratory data.

- Analyzes & evaluates each process of testing to assure final results are valid & accurate. Maintains & updates technical knowledge & skills by actively participating in department meetings, continuing education, & in-service instructions. Assists in development of operational procedures to ensure effective workflow.

- Serves as resource w/automated & other equipment, & in standard operation decision-making. Coordinates laboratory operations in absence of supervisor.

- Ensures compliance w/Quality Control & Quality Assurance Programs. Addresses quality of service issues, & to implement internal quality assurance monitors or projects.

- Takes corrective action to resolve problems. Reviews unresolved problems w/supervisor. Reports action limit results according to standard procedures.

- May serve as Testing Personnel as defined by CLIA '88 for High Complexity Testing. The testing personnel are responsible for specimen processing, test performance & for reporting test results. Each individual performs only those high complexity tests that are authorized by the laboratory director & require a degree of skill commensurate w/the individual's education, training or experience, & technical abilities. Each individual performing high complexity testing must follow the laboratory's procedures for specimen handling & processing, test analyses, reporting & maintaining records of patient test results; maintain records that demonstrate that proficiency testing samples are tested in the same manner as patient specimens; adhere to the laboratory's quality control policies, document all quality control activities, instrument & procedural calibrations & maintenance performed;Follow the laboratory's established policies & procedures whenever test systems are not w/in the laboratory's established acceptable levels of performance;Be capable of identifying problems that may adversely affect test performance or reporting of test results & either must correct the problems or immediately notify the supervisor;& document all corrective actions taken when test systems deviate from the laboratory's established performance specifications. If not qualified to perform testing independently, must perform high complexity testing only under the onsite direct supervision of a supervisor.

- Performs proficiency testing & reports results.

- Advises providers & nursing service personnel of correct procedures for collection, handling & processing of specimens. Assists providers in determining appropriate laboratory services to be used for patient care.

- Assists in training of technical students &/or new technologist employees.

- Assists in development of technical procedures & in writing training procedures. Reviews & critiques new procedures developed by others.

- Detects & repairs subtle instrument &/or reagent problems.

Basic Qualifications:

Experience

- Appropriate clinical internship.

Education

- Bachelor's degree in medical technology from accredited school OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field.

License, Certification, Registration

- Valid Hawaii Clinical Laboratory Technologist license (must meet education requirement(s) for Hawaii State licensure).

Additional Requirements:

- Good knowledge and skills of general clinical lab.

Additional responsibilities include compliance to regulatory guidelines, training, troubleshooting to continuously improve the quality standard of the test.

Processing clinical samples according to pre-specified protocols
Performing training and competency assessments
Participating in the laboratory’s quality assurance plan, adhering to quality control policies and documenting these activities
Performing proficiency testing
Troubleshooting and identifying problems that may adversely affect test performance
Assisting in achieving and maintaining laboratory certifications
Other duties as assigned

For Technologist I & Technologist Trainee Role - Eligibility for ASCP license is required. Experience with Molecular Biology laboratory work is required.
Excellent attention to detail is extremely important, as the workflow is complicated and requires thoughtful sample processing.

Ability to perform repetitive motions (e.g. pipetting)
Near vision acuity and depth perception

Location
Salt Lake City Metro Area, Utah

Since its inception in 1984, NCI has become one of the largest integrated manufacturers and marketers of metal coil coating solutions, insulated metal panels, metal components and custom metal building systems for the non-residential construction industry in North America. Product innovation, organic growth and numerous strategic and highly advantageous acquisitions have led to the continued development of this successful organization.

Responsibilities:
The Quality & Environmental Management Systems (QEMS) Technologist is responsible for ensuring that the Metal Coaters - Ohio (MCO) facility complies with all city, state and federal environmental compliance regulatory requirements. The QEMS is also responsible for managing the ISO-certified quality & environmental management systems at the facility.

The QEMS will report directly to the plant manager and will be tasked with the following duties, among others:

Manages and oversees day-to-day environmental compliance management programs, including inspections and recordkeeping tasks for air, wastewater, hazardous waste, spill prevention and emergency response for the facility.

Coordinates with the corporate environmental team on data collection, document distribution and report preparation as required by facility environmental permits. Ensures all necessary permits and certifications are maintained and posted within the facility.

Coordinates and manages the facility’s industrial and hazardous waste characterization and disposal activities, including managing disposal contractors and costs.

Ensures compliance with wastewater pretreatment discharge sampling requirements and conducts corrective action investigations related to instances of non-compliance.

Manages facility’s ISO-Certified Quality & Environmental Management System. Controls and updates revisions to the ISO document control system. Serves as facility SharePoint administrator for ISO document control site.

Manages facility non-conformance report, corrective and preventative action systems. Facilitates implementation of meaningful corrective actions to eliminate quality and/or environmental non-conformities.

Manages internal auditing activities associated with MCO’s ISO and regulatory requirements. Develops audit schedules, trains internal auditors, and ensures audit findings are communicated and effectively utilized within the organization.
Monitors regulatory developments and changes to ISO requirements. Reports potentially applicable changes to management to ensure facility stays up-to-date and in full compliance. Responsible for implementing regulatory compliance programs and emergency response plans.
Organizes and schedules ISO registrar registration and surveillance audits. Communicates and interfaces directly with registrar auditors. Communicates and coordinates with agency regulators and inspectors as required.
Ensures all MCO personnel receive appropriate training and resources necessary to fulfill all pertinent environmental and ISO responsibilities associated with their job position.
Communicates daily with maintenance, materials control, production, quality control, sales and shipping personnel to resolve problems and achieve the facility’s business, quality, and environmental objectives.

To be successful in this position, the candidate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.

Qualifications:

Engineering or Bachelor of Science degree with an environmental focus or specialization from an accredited four-year university is preferred.A minimum of two years of applicable industry or consulting environmental compliance experience may be considered in lieu of the educational requirement.

A comfortable working knowledge of air quality rules and NSR/Title V permitting; NPDES/wastewater permitting and reporting; and RCRA/EPCRA/DOT/SPCC regulations is preferred. Hands-on direct experience is a plus.

Must have the ability to read and grasp environmental regulations, technical documents, and mathematical calculations.

Must be positive, self-motivated, flexible, energetic and ethical; enjoy challenges and problem-solving; and be able to efficiently manage workflow, schedules and deadlines.

Must have effective communication skills, a customer-focused mindset, and ability to work with people of diverse backgrounds and personalities, from management to hourly plant personnel.

Proficiency with Excel is required.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee is frequently required to walk. The employee is occasionally required to stand; sit; use hands to handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance. Specific vision abilities include close-up and distance vision, color vision, peripheral
vision, and depth perception.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts, and is exposed to chemicals at safe levels and extreme cold or heat. The noise level in the work environment is considered moderate.

Before initiating work at MCO, the employee is required to read and understand the position's Job Safety Analysis (JSA). The employee must wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) and perform tasks in a manner consistent with NCI and Metal Coaters safety training, NCI Employee Manual and OSHA regulations.

Position Summary

The Clinical Pharmacology and Toxicology Laboratory at Columbia University Irving Medical Center seeking a dynamic Laboratory Technologist with significant understanding of measuring therapeutic drugs, and able to work in a fast-paced patient care environment.

The incumbent will conduct quantitative Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry (LC-MS) and High Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) assays to measure drugs in support of patient care. The individual will perform complex laboratory procedures in order to analyze clinical samples; this will require extensive, accurate, and efficient hands-on work, operating, maintaining and troubleshooting complex instrumentation, attention to detail, strict adherence to protocols, maintaining extensive and accurate documentation.

The incumbent will also have substantial administrative and quality assurance (QA) activities.

Responsibilities

+ Perform existing technical assays - 80%

+ Quality assurance, management, and improvement -10%

+ Other administrative/technical tasks as assigned - 10% **Duties will include:**

+ Performs test calibrations and runs Quality Control material at appropriate intervals.

+ Determines the acceptability of specimens for testing according to established criteria in testing procedures.

+ Determines calculated results utilizing testing data by means of manual or computerized procedures.

+ Accurately enters results of testing. Checks the computer review reports to monitor accurate reporting of laboratory results.

+ Evaluates the acceptability of routine analysis prior to releasing patient reports. Takes appropriate action in response to critical values or unusual or unexpected results, and documents action taken.

+ Responsible for performing preventative maintenance and/or calibration of laboratory equipment and properly documenting actions taken based on approved schedule.

+ Evaluates the results of instrument performance checks. Performs linearity, accuracy and precision checks as required.

+ Performs Q/C and calibrations with the appropriate frequency and evaluates results, to decide whether tests should be reported. Reports any shifts or trends to the Laboratory Director or his designee.

+ Recognizes problems, and initiates troubleshooting steps to evaluate testing failures and other problems, if necessary. Notifies the Laboratory Director or his designee, and contacts manufacturer for additional assistance or field service support, if required.

+ Promptly and courteously answers the phone and assists clients and other departments.

+ Maintains a safe and neat work area.

+ Maintains professional growth and development through continuing education activities.

+ Follows established university and department policies and procedures. Follows the guidelines for safety, environmental, and infection control.

+ Interacts with physicians, nurses, and other healthcare professionals on issues related to testing performed by the laboratory.

+ Maintains accurate and extensive documentation in accordance with internal and external regulatory agencies.

+ Sample receiving, processing, data entry.

+ Maintains inventory, requests orders as needed and verifies receipt and storage.

+ Monitors and maintains a consistent supply of reagents and consumables for the entire laboratory.

+ Assists in the development and validation of clinical assays if needed and generates the corresponding documentation of recommendations and findings.

+ Provides technical guidance and instruction to students, and new personnel, as assigned.

+ Attends continuing education, safety and compliance training as necessary

+ Maintains continuous and accurate communication with the Laboratory Director or his designee on all pending and current issues.

+ Prepares the work schedule for all staff in the Clinical Pharmacology and Toxicology Laboratory

+ Assumes oversight of Quality Management in the Clinical Pharmacology and Toxicology Laboratory in accordance with established SOP workflow and mandatory regulatory standards.

+ Collects, evaluates and distributes lab related quality tracking and trending data, ie test volumes, turn-around time, test failure rates and amendment rates for Oncology Service line and ensures prompt and regular communication to Faculty and management.

+ Continually monitors applicable lab performance indicators.

+ Maintains accurate documentation in accordance with internal and external regulatory agencies; ensures all SOPs are up to date.

+ Oversees the documentation and schedule of proficiency testing.

+ Participates in internal and external quality audits as required.

+ Maintains and renew current NYS licensure of the Laboratory as needed including annual educational requirements mandated by NYDOH/CAP.

+ The incumbent will also perform other duties as assigned.

+ Weekend hours may occasionally be necessary.

Minimum Qualifications

+ Master's degree and New York State License- Clinical Lab Technician/Technologist License or Histology Technician License plus 3 years of related experience or equivalent in education, training and experience. OR

+ BA/BS and New York State License- Clinical Lab Technician/Technologist License or Histology Technician License plus 6 years of related experience or equivalent in education, training and experience. OR

+ Equivalent in education, training, and experience.

Preferred Qualifications

+ Related experience in a clinical laboratory, or in a laboratory a clinical pharmacology focus is preferred.

+ Should be available to attend out-of-lab discussions and presentations, and must work well in a group environment.

+ Requires strong communication skills, both written and oral.

+ Should be able to perform efficiently in a fast-paced environment and meet strict deadlines.

+ The incumbent should have the potential to empower colleagues and contribute to a positive atmosphere in the lab.

+ Excellent ability to use computers and learn new software applications as necessary.

+ Experience with High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) and Liquid Chromatography - Mass Spectrometry (LC-MS).

+ Experience with Quality Assurance.

Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

Columbia University is committed to the hiring of qualified local residents.

Manage and train users in key management software like Jira, Confluence, InVision, SalesForce, and SharePoint. Engage deeply with technology organizations to integrate with their tools and processes.

Knowledgeable and practiced at multi-channel industry standards and best practices
Working knowledge of software used by designers and project managers
Experience in high-volume, error-free data entry
Experience managing complex and intensive processes

Is an enthusiastic, highly motivated self-starter with a strong work ethic and an intense focus on achieving results
Collaborates effectively to get things done, building and nurturing strong relationships
Is exceptional at problem-solving, issue resolution and time management
Demonstrates strong listening, communication and presentation skills
Is a continuous learner who adapts quickly and positively to change
Embraces the opportunity to work side by side with other designers and partners in a studio context (not remote)
Is available to travel up to 20% of time, and is able to work weekends and/or extended hours as needed
You’ll be better prepared if you have (desired skills)
Master’s degree with compensating experience
Financial or similar industry experience
We’re a culture that
Is committed to building a workplace where every employee is welcomed and given the support and resources to build and advance their careers. The Research Technologist will be a member of the investigative team in a busy academic laboratory studying cancer immunology and developing new cancer immunotherapies. The applicant will process human blood/tissue specimens, be responsible for independently performing experiments and contribute to general maintenance of laboratory, equipment and supplies.

Specific duties & responsibilities:
Experience with in vitro cell culture and experience and/or knowledge of molecular biology techniques preferred.
Follows established lab procedures and protocols and utilizes aseptic technique to perform experiments.
Process, store and log human clinical trial bio-specimens with meticulous care and accuracy.
Assists with research projects, published journal database searches, and troubleshooting.
Maintains sophisticated lab equipment.
Operates lab computers for data entry and analysis.
Maintains accurate, detailed data records.
Must be able to communicate well and work with teams.
Perform flow cytometry staining, acquisition and analysis (with FlowJo, CellQuest Pro, or similar tools).
Monitors inventory levels, order materials and supply in accordance with established policies and procedures.

Minimum qualifications (mandatory):

Bachelor’s degree in biology, chemistry, or related field required.

Preferred qualifications:
Some related experience such as experience with in vitro cell culture.
At least one year of post-undergraduate experience in a comparable laboratory, or a significant independent research project, not related to normal course requirements preferred.

Special knowledge, skills, and abilities:
Knowledge of Windows computers and Microsoft Office Applications

Technical qualifications or specialized certifications:
• Familiarity with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint software required.

Any specific physical requirements for the job:
May be required to life and/or move up to 50 pounds, usually less (example: liquid nitrogen freezer racks or supply boxes).
Occasionally required to traverse throughout the laboratory or to other locations on campus to conduct experiments and/or retrieve equipment, supplies, or specimens. The employee is required to operate computer keyboard, laboratory instruments, and small laboratory tools such as pipettes, cutting instruments, glassware, and/or glass slides. Constantly repositions self to perform duties at laboratory workstations, gathering specimens, and loading equipment.
Exposure to toxins and infectious agents exist, but potential for personal injury or harm is minimized if established safety and health precautions are followed. Able to read and understand
all Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) guidelines applicable to assigned work areas. Working in laboratory where there may be discomforts due to odors, noise, temperature fluctuations, and working around lab equipment. Research may include animal and human products, nucleic acids, radiation protocols and other bio-hazardous materials. Use of personal protective equipment may be advised or required

Classified Title: Research Technologist
Working Title: Research Technologist
Role/Level/Range: ACRO40/E/02/CC

Employee group: Full Time
Schedule: N/A

Personnel area: School of Medicine

During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.

The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers.
